Comment: Solohawk and I have played many times, and although he can play several openings, he tends to play more e4 than anything else. I used to answer e4 with Petrov's Defense, but more recently have played ...e5.
There is a good chance we will end up in a Ruy Lopez, but he is capable of playing several other choices as well.
And a Ruy it is.
And a Ruy it is.
And a Ruy it is.
I always play Morphy's 3...a6, but of course, it is not required.
The only move listed in MCO-13, but I believe I have seen analysis that shows 4. Bc4 is playable. I am too poor to afford an MCO-14 :)
The main line, although I have played the Accelerated Counterthrust Variation with 4...b5. Also playable is the Modern Steinitz Defense with 4...d6.
This is a very timid move that surrenders any hope of keeping the opening white initiative. The main line is 5. O-O.

It is probably better to attack white's center with 5...d5, but I wasn't sure I liked the line:
5...d5
6. exd5 Qxd5 (...Nxd5 will drop the e pawn after the trade on c6)
7. Bxc6  bxc6
8. Nc3
The text forces white's bishop onto a nice diagonal, but I will try to deal with that shortly.
Better late than never. In an e4 opening, black's goal is to get in ...d5 without it conceding anything to white. I believe with this move black has achieved equality.
Better late than never. In an e4 opening, black's goal is to get in ...d5 without it conceding anything to white. I believe with this move black has achieved equality.
Creating complicating tactics, but with Solohawk I will always try to trade queens and head for an endgame.
And so I hope for 8. dxe4 when I can trade the queens off.
I assume this is an attempt to decoy my queen, as recapturing with the pawn will break up my kingside.
But that is a price I am willing to pay in order to get the queens off.
Neglecting the fact that his knight was en prise.
So I am happy to win a piece.
Threatening a nasty fork with Qxc6 .
Which I totally overlook because I am so anxious to get castled.
But then he fails to pull the trigger on his threat.
And I finally realize the danger and deal with it. The second reason for this move it to play 12...Na5 with a discovery on the queen that will allow me to trade off white's bishop.
A curious move that seems out of place. I think centralizing the rooks was probably a better choice.
